definitions.definition: a feeling that makes one self-conscious and unable to act in a relaxed and natural way.
examples: the children, at first shy, soon lost their inhibitions
synonyms: reservation; psychological block; informalhang-up "they overcame their inhibitions"

definitions.definition: a voluntary or involuntary restraint on the direct expression of an instinct.
the action of inhibiting, restricting, or hindering a process.
examples: hindrance, hampering, discouragement, obstruction, impediment, suppression, repression, restriction, restraint, constraint, cramping, stifling, prevention; Morecurb, check, bar, barrier "writing without inhibition"Morecurb, check, bar, barrier writing without inhibition

definitions.definition: the slowing or prevention of a process, reaction, or function by a particular substance.
